pageTitle: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau meets with Édouard Philippe, Prime Minister of France | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Today, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau met with Édouard Philippe, Prime Minister of the French Republic.

The two prime ministers discussed a wide range of common priorities, including progressive trade, cultural cooperation, emerging technologies, and artificial intelligence.

They discussed the enhanced opportunities for commercial exchange between Canada and France as a result of the Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA).

Prime Minister Trudeau and Prime Minister Philippe emphasized the profound nature of the relationship and enduring friendship between Canada and France. They also discussed opportunities for strengthening collaboration between both countries on the world stage.
